data.title: Khao Kradong land dispute: A ‘big house’ in Buri Ram under spotlight
data.description: Reports show the disputed 5,083 rai linked to the prominent Chidchob family, as SRT appeals the land department’s decision not to revoke title deeds

data.title: AI to help raise access to quality education
data.description: BURI RAM - The Ministry of Education is calling on schools nationwide to improve the quality of their teaching to align with the latest technology including  artificial intelligence , according to Deputy Education Minister Surasak Phancharoenworakul.

data.title: 2 students killed, 12 hurt as truck hits school pickup
data.description: PATTANI: Two students were killed and 12 others hurt, one badly, when a six-wheel truck hit a parked pickup carrying students in Sai Buri district of this southern province on Friday.

data.title: Veterinarian ‘didn’t knock out TV cat’
data.description: The person who anaesthetised a black  cat  in the TV drama  The Empress of Ayodhaya , also known as Mae Yua, was not a veterinarian but someone from the agency that provided the animal, according to the Department of Livestock Development.

data.title: Tense moments at France-Israel football match
data.description: PARIS - Some French fans booed the Israeli national anthem and there were minor scuffles inside a sparsely attended Stade de France on Thursday for a Nations League football match overshadowed by frictions around the Gaza war.

data.title: Thunderstorms to blanket Greater Bangkok as rain refuses to let up
data.description: Rain is predicted in Bangkok and its vicinity until Monday, according to the Meteorological Department.

data.title: Ex-MP queries Khao Kradong dispute, cites Chai Chidchob’s land deal
data.description: Former Bangkok MP asks if Supreme Court rulings are being ignored because a certain minister’s ID lists the disputed land as their home address

data.title: Chinese defence firms to attend Vietnam arms fair as ties deepen
data.description: HANOI: Chinese defence firms will participate in an arms fair in Vietnam next month, a Vietnamese defence official said on Friday, a possible sign of deepening military ties between the two neighbours.

data.title: Thai soldiers ‘tortured and killed Myanmar migrant’, rights group says
data.description: A human rights group has called on Thai authorities to fully investigate three soldiers for the “horrific” death of a Myanmar migrant on the border in Tak province earlier this year, saying they had tortured and beaten the man.

data.title: Zero waste, zero hunger
data.description: Zero waste is the “in” thing for the food industry. Combating it, however, has always been challenging, and Thai fine dining restaurant Nusara is pushing it in a new direction.

data.title: ONE Championship: Jo Nattawut returns vs Bampara Kouyate at ONE 170 in Bangkok
data.description: Fan favourite “Smokin’” Jo Nattawut will return to ONE Championship action against Bampara Kouyate, a source told the Bangkok Post.

data.title: High energy consumption of AI, GenAI raises power shortage fears
data.description: There has been a surge in electricity consumption due to artificial intelligence and generative AI (GenAI), and data centres are forecasting growth of up to 160% over the next two years, according to the latest Gartner's report released on Thursday.

data.title: DOTOY x Jungceylon: A Celestial Collaboration
data.description: “Jungceylon” Creates New Landmark, Collaborates with Korean Artist “DOTOY X JUNGCEYLON”, Launching “Angel Boy” to Delight Art Toy Enthusiasts, Aiming to Boost Phuket Tourism to Attract Visitors Worldwide

data.title: Outcry over case of a man adopting dogs and subsequently eating them
data.description: Watchdog Thailand Foundation calls for stricter penalties against culprits

data.title: Krirk University Ranked Among Top 150 in Asia
data.description: Krirk University has once again secured its place among Asia’s top 150 universities, ranking 141st overall and 5th in Thailand in the latest QS Asia University Rankings, hosted on November 6, 2024. This achievement, celebrated at the Asia-Pacific Higher Education Summit, held by Quacquarelli Symonds (QS) at Macau University of Science and Technology, marks the third consecutive year that Krirk University has reached this elite ranking. The summit, the largest higher education conference in the Asia-Pacific region organised by QS, also showcased the 2025 rankings, highlighting the university’s dedication to academic excellence and innovation.

data.title: No terror threat to Koh Pha-ngan Full Moon Party: police chief
data.description: Police chief dismisses rumours of a terrorist plot targeting Israelis, saying the authorities are closely monitoring the situation to ensure safety

data.title: UNICEF Launches “Box of Life” Campaign to Urgently Aid Children in Crisis
data.description: UNICEF Thailand has unveiled the “Box of Life” campaign, rallying everyone to take action and donate essential aid to children in crisis. Part of the broader  “A Better Tomorrow Today”  initiative, the campaign aims to build a brighter future for underprivileged children in Thailand and worldwide, focusing on critical needs such as health, nutrition, disaster relief, and social equity.

data.title: A “paw-sitive” approach to celebrate an eco-friendly Loy Krathong
data.description: An Ubon Ratchathani initiative creates krathong made from banana leaves filled with food for stray animals

data.title: Five Star Chicken: Showcasing Thai Soft Power through Flavour
data.description: Thai cuisine is one of Thailand

data.title: Elderly likely to receive 10,000-baht handout in 2nd phase
data.description: The deputy finance minister said senior citizens aged 60 and above are being prioritised as they face a greater challenge in earning income

data.title: Japanese ambassador shows how Loy Krathong can be eco-friendly
data.description: The video clip shows the envoy crafting a star-shaped krathong from banana leaves before he launches it into the river

data.title: Weakening baht to remain volatile until November-end, say currency analysts
data.description: The baht would face short-term volatility until the end of November due to funds flows into the US after Donald Trump won the presidential election, several currency analysts said on Friday.

data.title: Thailand Honours Creativity at the CE Awards 2024
data.description: The Creative Economy Agency (CEA) hosted the Creative Excellence Awards 2024 to honour Thai creatives whose innovative work has made a meaningful impact on society, the environment, and the national economy.

data.title: Agriculture in focus as Thailand and Hong Kong aim to expand trade ties
data.description: Pichai makes case for more investment in meeting with HK official at APEC Summit in Peru

data.title: Thailand to be removed soon from US intellectual property watch list
data.description: The US would soon remove Thailand from its watch list on intellectual property protection, Commerce Minister Pichai Naripthaphan said on Thursday.

data.title: Thai employees favour 4-day work week for better life balance: survey
data.description: A survey covering 11 Asian countries shows most Thai workers are willing to work longer hours for a shorter work week, citing better work-life balance

data.title: Your horoscope for Nov 15-21
data.description: Your spot-on horoscope for work, money and relationship from Guru by the Bangkok Post

data.title: Motor Expo 2024 aims to give ailing Thai auto industry a shot in the arm
data.description: 42 car brands from nine countries, 22 motorcycle brands from 7 countries to be showcased

data.title: International artistry on display at world puppet festival in Thailand
data.description: Professional puppet artists from 13 countries are demonstrating their skills in imparting scientific knowledge at the National Science Museum (NSM) in Pathum Thani province, which is hosting the Harmony World Puppet Innovation Festival 2024.

data.title: PM pushes Thailand’s tech potential in private sector meetings
data.description: Paetongtarn meets with top executives of Google, TikTok and Microsoft to discuss government’s emphasis on digital skills

data.title: EC explains new Provincial Administrative Organisations poll date
data.description: The election of chairs and members of Provincial Administrative Organisations (PAOs) will be held on Saturday, Feb 1, instead of Sunday, Feb 2, in a bid to ensure the vote runs smoothly given the legal limitations outlined in the election law, EC commissioner Santhat Siriananpaiboon says.

data.title: Thaksin promises big economic reforms in Udon Thani
data.description: While campaigning for Pheu Thai’s PAO candidate, former PM vows to ease hardships and deliver a revitalised local economy by mid-2025

data.title: State Railway of Thailand defies Department of Lands in Buri Ram dispute
data.description: The State Railway of Thailand (SRT) has appealed the Department of Lands (DoL) decision not to revoke land title documents issued for plots of land in Buri Ram

data.title: IRPC Secures Place in Dow Jones Sustainability Indices for 11th Year
data.description: IRPC has once again proven its dedication to sustainability by securing its position in the prestigious Dow Jones Sustainability Indices (DJSI) for the 11th consecutive year. This recognition highlights the company

data.title: Finance Ministry sees THAI’s rehab exit in Feb, no extra funds needed
data.description: The Thai national carrier is on track to exit its rehabilitation process by February 2025, with plans to re-list on the Stock Exchange by May thanks to strong performance

data.title: Prime Minister Paetongtarn advances key agendas at Apec forum
data.description: Prime Minister  Paetongtarn Shinawatra  will meet Chinese President  Xi Jinping  and other world leaders at the four-day 31st  Apec Economic Leaders

data.title: Leopard spotted in Kaeng Krachan park
data.description: A leopard was spotted wandering around a helipad in Kaeng Krachan National Park in Phetchaburi province, believed to be waiting for its prey.

data.title: Pheu Thai, Thaksin face crucial test in Udon Thani election
data.description: Surge in support for People’s Party at next week’s PAO election could signal trouble for Shinawatra-led government
